title: 107_hr2934
content: The Act titled "Medicare Aural Rehabilitation and Hearing Aid Coverage Act of 2001" provides coverage for hearing rehabilitation. The "Medicare Aural Rehabilitation and Hearing Aid Coverage Act of 2001" expands coverage to include aural rehabilitation services and hearing aids as durable medical equipment under the Social Security Act. The Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection regarding Medicare coverage for aural rehabilitation services and hearing aids. "Hearing rehabilitation services are now covered under Medicare." The term 'hearing rehabilitation' includes aural rehabilitation services and hearing aids. A comprehensive audiologic assessment is also part of the services provided for individuals with hearing loss. The term 'hearing aid' refers to a wearable device for individuals with hearing loss that meets FDA requirements. It includes services provided by a physician or audiologist authorized by state law. Services may include audiology services and a threshold test for audio acuity. The individuals described in this subparagraph have a hearing loss that can be treated with a hearing aid. They have not received a hearing aid in the past 3 years and are eligible for audiology services, hearing aid assessment, procurement, fitting, instruction, refittings, adjustments, and rehabilitation. The text discusses the eligibility criteria for individuals who have not received a hearing aid in the past 3 years and may require audiology rehabilitation services. Amendments are made to the Social Security Act to include rehabilitation services and exceptions to coverage for hearing rehabilitation. Amendments to the Social Security Act include adding audiology rehabilitation services and exceptions to coverage for hearing rehabilitation. The effective date for these changes is the date of enactment of the Act, with final regulations to be published no later than January 1, 2003.
